body:
Hello @jorisvandenbossche! Thanks for updating the PR.







Cheers ! There are no PEP8 issues in this Pull Request. :beers: 

##### Comment last updated on March 01, 2018 at 12:51 Hours UTC

> Maybe we could somehow connect with the numpydoc process and after its processing remove it ..

So that is what I did. Not fully sure this is a good idea, as it adds to the technical debt of our complex doc building machinery, but, it solves the warnings and ugly html output (see eg methods section in http://pandas-docs.github.io/pandas-docs-travis/generated/pandas.Int64Index.html#pandas.Int64Index)

> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/19949?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [c8859b5...ce27711](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/19949?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).
I think since you're using an official sphinx event to processes the docstring, it's fine. Much less of a hack than what we've done in the past :)
Travis log file looks good now!
